name: World League Soccer '98
description:
In World League Soccer '98 the player is able to move, kick, chip, volley and perform advanced passing techniques, including one-twos, chip returns and swerved long-balls. Players can also chest and head the ball with total control. Also, it is possible to alter pitch type, weather conditions, and stadium design.

There are eight major European leagues plus the US and Japanese leagues, with 145 teams available to choose from, as well as international competitions which can be custom-designed. Live commentary is provided by Peter Brackley and Ray Wilkins, and motion capture by Les Ferdinand.

shot.caption: The game's splash screen is the first thing the player sees, after this come the company logo's which are in turn followed by a video montage
After the company logos have been displayed the player is treated to a montage of in-game screens mixed with  animated on-pitch action and sequences of black and white video
The game's title screen follows the video montage, the language selection screen and the memory card check
The options sub menu is a vertically scrolling list. The options are:SoundGame RulesController ConfigEnvironmentMiscellaneousPlayer Editorand Load/Save Options
The Player Editor screen where a player name is being changed
Setting up a matchThe first step is to select a league. In addition to the leagues shown here there are also two International leagues
Setting up a game in the American LeagueIn addition to the options shown here the menu scrolls vertically to offer Season, Practice and the Game Configuration Options
Assigning teams to the human and computer prior to kicking off
Preparing to kick off in a Practice Match. The letters in the word PRACTICE fly on to the screen and rapidly fly off, the same happens when a THROW IN or a CORNER takes place
This is a throw in, the arrow indicates where the ball will be thrown and it can be adjusted by the player
This is a corner, the arrow indicates where the ball will be thrown and it can be adjusted by the player
